intro: Xylopia usitata, commonly known as African bitter almond, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature and turn yellow or red when ripe. The fruit contains a single large seed enclosed in a hard, woody capsule. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
